title: Why the UN Is Taking on Plastic Pollution

readable_content:
- User (2023-12-08): How extensive is plastic pollution, and what is being done to address the issue?

- The United Nations is fast-tracking discussions to forge an international agreement to curb plastic waste, which is one of the most pervasive and hazardous environmental pollutants. The resolution passed by the UN Environment Assembly (UNEA) sets out a diplomatic framework and timeline for UN members to negotiate an agreement to prevent and reduce global plastic waste. Plastic is a major source of pollution, particularly in the world’s oceans, and about 400 million tons of plastic waste are produced each year. The United Nations projects that greenhouse gas emissions associated with the plastic lifecycle will account for 15 percent of global carbon emissions by 2050. Nations have already taken steps to mitigate plastic waste generation, and the new UN resolution lays out strategies governments can use to address the problem, including adopting circular economies.
